1.content:
The Exotic Adventure was a state of the art ship designed for young adults over the age of 21. It was designed to be a childless cruise and have many high energy activities on the ship. There were singles clubs, nudist lounges, multi-deck games of laser tag and even a zombie outbreak event.

It currently had two thousand people on board, including passengers and crew. Even though it was aimed at younger passengers there were still a few people who were young in spirit, with a few cougars in their 40s being the oldest passengers. The oldest crew member however was the captain, who was in his early 50s, while the oldest person on board was the CEO of the cruise line who was just shy of sixty. He had brought his two daughters, who were in their early twenties and his thirty-five year old son on board as well. Most of the other crew were under the age of thirty.

The ship had left from Los Angeles and was sailing down the cost of Baja California. It was sailing to Costa Rica, stopping by Mexico along the way. Then it would head straight back to the US.

The ship would never make it that far, as a massive storm struck a day or so into the cruise, catching everyone unaware. The ocean was so strong, it pulled the ship into an extremely fast current, taking the ship due south and below the equator. They were now in the middle of the Southern Pacific Ocean in a place the ocean currents usually go.

The ship was dead in the water, though the seas around them, while a terrifying dark blue, remained unusually calm. Given their location, the crew thought it best that they did not abandon ship as the life boats wouldn't be able to reach safety before they ran out of supplies and a cruise ship would be easier to spot by their rescuers.

What the crew did not tell their passengers though, was their communications had been damaged by the storm, they could receive but could not transmit. Rescue was not coming and they were too far out at sea to find safety. They were lost at sea.

Only the bridge crew knew that last part however and they were going to keep everyone calm for as long as possible. Though strange things already began to occur and things were only going to get weirder from here.

How does this story begin?
1.title: Lost at Sea

The first day lost at sea was all about recovery and keeping people calm. The ship was without power and there were many injuries from the ship's sudden surge forward, a few people had been thrown overboard (though they were swept up in the same current that brought the ship to Point Nemo). People had to be pulled from elevators and rescued from other areas. There were people breaking open the lockers in the nudist lounge, to get people their clothes and belongings. And the passengers were being kept near the assembly areas, in case of evacuation. Though that call hadn't been made.

The Captain assured everyone to remain safe and that they had sent out a distress call and that help was on its way. It was a lie. They were too far from anywhere to get help.

Though as the day went by strange things began to happen. People began to vanish, while others weren't themselves. some new pieces of artwork appeared in the hallways while there were also reports of animals loose on the ship. info.brief_description: A Cruise ship finds itself stuck out at sea and those on board begin to change.
info.description:
This is an adults only cruise line, targeted at young people in their early twenties. It is on its maiden voyage sailing from California, down to South America when it was hit by a freak storm. It is now impossibly off course as all navigational tools seem to indicate the ship is near point Nemo (the furthest place from land in the ocean).

The storm and their co-ordinates are the least of their worries though, as strange happenings begin to occur on the ship with every day bringing some new kind of change.

Rules
Death of any of the characters are fine. Though that doesn't mean the story has to end, new victims can be discovered and death can be reversed

When dealing with characters under the age of 18, be mindful how you treat them, I will not tolerate any nudity or sex and these chapters will be deleted. I'd rather not have anyone under age but that does remove the ability for age regression.

Be mindful of other people when writing, leaving as many options available as possible. If you can only add two paths I'd rather you do 'more options' as the second choice allowing for others to add their own ideas. On that note be careful how long you make your chapters, they shouldn't be too short however they should also leave room for choice. So don't write too many transformations or actions in a single chapter where another choice was available.

I am impulsive and do change my mind often so do except to see the occasional change in the structure of the interactive or some of my additions being edited. I will try not to delete chapters and if an idea I thought of gets taken I will use the more options or edit the choices so both out ideas for that choice can be expressed. (On that note, if anyone wanted to add to a particular option that was taken feel free to repeat that choice with your own idea).
